description: Redevelopment of the site, following demolition of the existing buildings, to provide a first team training and academy facility for Queen's Park Rangers Football Club, incorporating a two-storey, with basement, training centre building, a three-storey multi-functional operations building, to be built in two phases, an indoor hall building, a single storey maintenance building and single storey plant building, along with three first team pitches and eight academy/youth pitches, plus the re-provision of community facilities incorporating a single storey community building linked to the indoor hall (shared with QPR), with changing rooms, showers, wcs and social space and up to eleven football pitches, including one artificial pitch and three cricket wickets. In addition, the development proposes associated developments including 263 permanent car parking spaces (plus overspill parking for a further 292 cars), flood lighting, boundary treatments, an additional vehicle and pedestrian point of access onto Windmill Lane, hard and soft landscaping and engineering works to re-grade the site to provide level playing surfaces (with site levels increasing in part by a maximum of 5m).
decision_conditions: 1. The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

REASON: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning. | 3. No part of the development shall be brought into use until full details of both hard and soft landscape works and planting schedule, including a phased programme of works, have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority and these

works shall be carried out as approved prior to the first use of any part of the development or in accordance with the programme agreed by the Local Planning Authority. Any trees or other plants, which die or are removed within the first five years following the implementation of the landscaping scheme, shall be replaced during the next planting season.

REASON:  To ensure that the development is landscaped in the interests of the visual character and appearance of the area, in accordance with policies 7.17, 7.19 and 7.21 of the London Plan (2015), policies 5.2, 5.4 and 6.3 of the Ealing Development Strategy DPD (2012) and policies 5.10 and 5.11 of the Development Management Development Plan Document (2013). | 4. No part of the development shall be brought into use until full details indicating the positions, design, materials and type of boundary treatment to be erected have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The boundary treatment shall be completed prior to the first use of any part of the development. Development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details.

REASON: To protect the visual appearance of the area and the living conditions of neighbouring occupiers, in accordance with policies 7.4 and 7.5 of the London Plan (2015), policies 5.4 and 6.3 of the Ealing Development Strategy DPD (2012) and Policy 7B of the adopted Development Management DPD (2013). | 5. The area beneath the spread of the branches of the trees to be retained as shown on the approved drawings shall not be used for the storage of building materials, plant, machinery or other items, or for vehicular access or for the burning of materials of any kind.

REASON: To prevent damage to the trees in the interest of the visual character and appearance of the area, in accordance with policies 7.17, 7.19 and 7.21 of the London Plan (2015), policies 5.2 and 5.4 of the Ealing Development Strategy DPD (2012) and Policy 5.10 of the adopted Development Management DPD (2013). | 6. No sound amplification devices shall be utilised within the open areas of the site.

REASON: To protect the living conditions of adjacent occupiers, in accordance with policies 7.15 and 7.17 of the London Plan (2015), Policy 5.2 of the Ealing Development Strategy DPD (2012), Policy 7A of the adopted Development Management DPD (2013) and the advice contained within the Council's interim guidance 'Noise and Vibration' (formerly SPG 10 detailing noise criteria). | 7. The new access as approved at Windmill Lane shall be constructed before any part of the development permitted is first occupied or brought into use.

REASON: In the interests of highway safety, in accordance with Policy 6.11 of the London Plan (2015) and in accordance with Ealing's Local Implementation Plan - Transport Delivery 2014 - 2017. | 8. A) No development shall take place in each phase until the applicant has secured the implementation of a programme of archaeological mitigation in accordance with a Written Scheme of Investigation which has been submitted by the applicant and approved by the local planning authority.
B) No development or demolition shall take place in each phase other than that in accordance with the Written Scheme of Investigation approved under Part (A).

C) The development shall not be occupied until the site investigation and post investigation assessment has been completed in accordance with the programme set out in the Written Scheme of Investigation approved under Part (A), and the provision made for analysis, publication and dissemination of the results and archive deposition has been secured.

REASON: Heritage assets of archaeological interest may survive on the site. The planning authority wishes to secure the provision of archaeological investigation and the subsequent recording of the remains prior to development, in accordance with the NPPF, Policy 7.8 of the London Plan (2015) and Policy 7C of the adopted Development Management Plan DPD (2013). | 9. Notwithstanding the approved Energy Statement (23 April 2015), Design Note (14 July 2015), Appendices including BRUKL modelling output reports, CHP info (150709 QPR Phase 2 CHP study - EnergyPRO output & CHP Design information) and LBE Appendix B Technical data, prepared by Buro Happold, before any development (excluding demolition, site preparation works, site remediation works, regrading or the formation of accesses) is commenced, a detailed report, and other supporting information providing details of the sustainability measures to be incorporated into the development, shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority and approved in writing. The approved strategy shall be implemented on-site in the approved manner and maintained in perpetuity. The Energy Strategy shall be based on connecting all buildings of the development to the site wide Combined Heat and Power (CHP) District Heating (DH) network, unless otherwise agreed with the Local Planning Authority.

The Energy Strategy shall outline the measures to be incorporated into the development to achieve an overall reduction in carbon dioxide emissions by 35% (regulated carbon dioxide emissions) above Building Regulations 2013.
Carbon dioxide emissions associated with other energy uses not covered by Building Regulations (un-regulated) should be also included and measures to reduce them should be demonstrated in the report.

Within 6 months from the first occupation of each phase of the development, Energy Performance Certificates [EPC's], Display Energy Certificates (DEC's) for all elements of the development and modelling output reports from the "as built stage" following completion of each phase of the development to confirm compliance in terms of savings achieved through energy efficiency measures should be also submitted for written approval by the Local Authority.

REASON: To secure the measures set out within the approved Energy Statement and to ensure that the energy efficiency measures to be incorporated into the approved development contribute to reducing the use of fossil fuel or other primary energy generation capacity, to reduce emissions of greenhouse gases, and to minimise the impact of building emissions on local air quality in the interests of health, in accordance with policies 3.2, 5.3, 5.5, 5.6 and 7.14 of the London Plan 2015, policies 1.1(e), 1.1(j), 1.1(k) and 1.2(f) of Ealing's adopted Development (or Core) Strategy 2012, policies LV5.2 and 7A of Ealing's Development Management DPD, and the Mayor's Sustainable Design and Construction SPG. | 10. Each non-residential building hereby permitted shall be constructed to achieve a minimum Building Research Establishment BREEAM overall Very Good Standard (based on BREEAM 2014 Technical Guidance) whilst continuous investigation for achieving Excellent should be carried out.

Within three months of the commencement of the development, evidence that the development is registered with the Building Research Establishment (BRE) under the BREEAM 2014 New Construction Scheme and an Interim BREEAM 2014 NC Assessment and related Certification for the relevant part of the development shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for written approval.

Within three months from the date of first occupation, a BREEAM 'Post Construction Stage' Assessment and related Certification for the relevant part of the development verified by the BRE will be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for written approval confirming the BREEAM standard and measures have been implemented.

Following any approval of a 'Post Construction Stage' assessment and certificate of the relevant part of the development, the approved measures and technologies to achieve the BREEAM Very Good standard shall be retained in working order in perpetuity.

REASON: In the interest of addressing climate change and to secure sustainable development in accordance with policies 5.1, 5.2, 5.3, 5.6, 5.7 and 5.9 of the London Plan 2015, policies LV5.2 and 7A of Ealing's Development Management DPD 2013, and policies 1.1(k) and 1.2(f) of Ealing's Development (Core) Strategy 2012. | 11. Details shall be submitted for the approval of the Local Planning Authority before any development (excluding demolition, site preparation works, site remediation works, regrading or the formation of accesses), is commenced, for the composite sound reduction index, Rw, for the building envelope of the proposed development, with windows and doors closed and other means of ventilation provided, the details to ensure that an acoustic standard of not greater than LFNR35 Leq,5min (octaves) or LFNR30 Leq,5min (one third octaves) will be achieved at 1m from the nearest façade of the nearest affected premises. The approved insulation shall be implemented before the development of each relevant building is commenced and retained permanently thereafter.

REASON: In order to minimise the emission of noise from the built development proposed to protect the amenities of the area and those of neighbouring residents, in accordance with Policy 7.15 of the London Plan (2015), policies 1.1 (j) of the Ealing Development Core Strategy (2012) and policies 3.5 and 7A of Ealing's Development Management DPD (2013) and the advice contained in the Council's adopted Supplementary Planning Guidance (SPG) 10: 'Noise and Vibration'. | 12. Details shall be submitted for the approval of the Local Planning Authority before any development (excluding demolition, site preparation works, site remediation works, regrading or the formation of accesses) is commenced, for the composite sound reduction index, Rw, for the building envelope of the proposed development with windows and doors closed and other means of ventilation provided, the details to ensure that the rating noise level at sensitive facades, as assessed under BS4142: 1997, will be lower than the existing background noise level LA90 by at least 5 dBA, during the relevant period of operation. The approved insulation shall be implemented before the development of each relevant building is commenced and retained permanently thereafter.

REASON: In order to minimise the emission of noise from the built development proposed to protect the amenities of the area and those of neighbouring residents, in accordance with Policy 7.15 of the London Plan (2015), policies 1.1 (j) of the Ealing Development Core Strategy (2012) and policies 3.5 and 7A of Ealing's Development Management DPD (2013) and the advice contained in the Council's adopted Supplementary Planning Guidance (SPG) 10: 'Noise and Vibration'. | 13. Details shall be submitted for the approval of the Local Planning Authority prior to the commencement of the development demonstrating that the rating sound level emitted from the external plant and machinery at the proposed development, as assessed under BS4142: 2014, shall not exceed the existing background sound level, as measured at the nearest sensitive facades, during the relevant periods of operation. The works shall be completed prior to occupation and permanently retained thereafter.

REASON: In order to minimise the emission of noise from the built development proposed to protect the amenities of the area and those of neighbouring residents, in accordance with Policy 7.15 of the London Plan (2015), Policy 7A of Ealing Development Management DPD safeguarding Amenity the advice contained in the Council's adopted Supplementary Planning Guidance (SPG) 10: 'Noise and Vibration'. | 14. Car parking areas within the application site shall be managed to ensure that LAmax,1hr(fast response) noise level from the manoeuvring and starting of vehicles within the car parks shall not to exceed the following criteria:-
" 60 dBA at 3.5 m from the nearest façade of the nearest affected dwelling during the period 23:00 to 07:00 hrs, where less than 15 noise events occur for the period.

" 55 dBA at 3.5 m from the nearest façade of the nearest affected dwelling during the period 23:00 to 07:00 hrs, where greater than 15 noise events occur, during the period and/or low background noise levels prevail, a combination of noise and vibration is produced and sources with significant low frequency content are present.
" 65 dBA at 3.5 m from the nearest façade of the nearest affected dwelling during the period 0700 to 23:00 hrs.

REASON: In order to minimise the emission of noise from the built development proposed to protect the amenities of the area and those of neighbouring residents, in accordance with Policy 7.15 of the London Plan (2015), Policy 7A of the adopted Development Management DPD (2013) and the advice contained in the Council's adopted Supplementary Planning Guidance (SPG) 10: 'Noise and Vibration'. | 15. Prior to commencement of construction and demolition works, a detailed Construction Logistics Plan (CLP), shall be submitted for the written approval of the Planning Authority and thereafter implemented on-site in the approved manner. The CLP shall include details of dust mitigation and Noise/Vibration measures as required using Greater London Authority Best Practice Guidance 'The Control of Dust and Emissions from Construction and Demolition', 2006 and in accordance with BS 5228-1:2009 - Code of practice for noise & vibration control on construction & open sites-Part 1: Noise
The Construction Logistics Plan shall contain:
i) Details of how large construction vehicles will access and egress the site, including routings to the Main Distributor Road network and associated traffic management;
ii) arrangements for vehicle servicing and turning areas;
iii) arrangements for the parking of contractors vehicles;
iv) details of site compound(s) and the location and layout of temporary construction buildings;
v) arrangements for the storage of materials;
vi) details of any lighting of construction areas;
vii) proposed hours of work.

REASON: In the interest of safeguarding the amenity of the surrounding residents and Metropolitan Open Land and to ensure that the implementation of the development does not disrupt the local highway network, in accordance with policies 5.3, 6.11 and 7.17 of the London Plan (2015), Policies 5.2 and 7A of the Development (or Core) Strategy (2012) and the advice contained within Council's adopted Supplementary Planning Guidance 10: 'Noise and Vibration'. | 16. The proposed system of odour abatement equipment shall be installed prior to the occupation of buildings on-site and thereafter operated and permanently maintained in the approved manner.

REASON: In the interests of the amenities of the area, in accordance with policies 7.4, 7.14 and 7.17 of the London Plan (2015) and Policy 7A of the adopted Ealing Development Management DPD. | 17. The development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved Ground Investigation and Remediation Strategy Rev 02 (BuroHappold Engineering, April 2015) and its mitigatory design measures and Verification and Monitoring Programme.

Following completion of measures identified in the approved remediation scheme, a verification report that demonstrates the effectiveness of the implemented remediation shall be produced and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The verification report shall be submitted in accordance with the Environment Agency guidance 'Verification of Remediation of Land Contamination', Report: SC030114/R1.

REASON: In the interests of the health and safety of the public, in accordance with Policy 5.21 of the London Plan (2015) and Ealing Local Variation to LP Policy 5.21 of the Ealing Development Management DPD 2013. | 18. Installation of external lighting shall be implemented and maintained in accordance with the details outlined in the Lighting Assessment.

Floodlighting detailed in the application shall not operate beyond 22:30 hours on any day and shall not operate between 1st June and 31st July (inclusive) unless otherwise first agreed, in writing, by the Local Planning Authority.

REASON: In order to safeguard the amenities and biodiversity value of the area, in accordance with policies 7.3, 7.4, 7.17 and 7.19 of the London Plan (2015), policies 5.2 and 5.6 of the Ealing Development (or Core) Strategy (2012) and Policy 7A on Amenity of the adopted Development Management DPD (2013) and in the interest of the amenity of the Metropolitan Open Land, ecological interests and the amenity of the surrounding residential occupiers. | 19. Prior to the commencement of any development on the site, including site clearance, site preparation and/or demolition works, a detailed Ecological Construction Method Statement (ECMS) shall be submitted to and approved, in writing, by the Local Planning Authority. The ECMS shall be produced incorporating the detailed content set out in Ecological and Habitat Assessment (EDP, April 2015): protective measures for trees, grassland, hedgerows and relocated topsoil; precautionary checks in respect of roosting bats; sensitive timing of works, and/or precautionary checks, in respect of nesting birds; phased vegetation clearance and precautionary checks in respect of reptiles and of badgers. The development shall be implemented on site, in the approved manner.

REASON: In order to protect the biodiversity value of the site and area, in accordance with policies 7.17 and 7.19 of the London Plan (2015), Policy 5.4 of Ealing's adopted Development (Core) Strategy 2026 and Policy 2.18 of Ealing's adopted Development Management DPD 2013. | 20. Prior to the commencement of any development on the site, including site clearance, site preparation and/ or demolition works, a detailed Landscape and/or Ecological Management Plan (EMP) shall be submitted to and approved, in writing, by the Local Planning Authority. The EMP shall be produced incorporating the detailed content set out in Ecological and Habitat Assessment (EDP, April 2015) and include details on new native tree and shrub planting; creation of new species-rich grassland; management of new and retained species-rich grassland; and new habitat features for roosting bats and nesting birds. Once approved, the development shall be carried out and maintained fully in accordance with the approved EMP.

REASON: In order to protect the biodiversity value of the site and area, in accordance with policies 7.17 and 7.19 of the London Plan (2015) and Policy 5.4 of Ealing's adopted Development (Core) Strategy 2026 and Policy 2.18 of Ealing's adopted Development Management DPD 2013. | 21. The development hereby approved, with the exception of demolition of site buildings and formation of accesses, shall not commence until a detailed surface water drainage scheme, based on the agreed Flood Risk Assessment (Rev 00, April 2015, BuroHappold) has been submitted and approved by the Planning Authority and thereafter implemented on-site in the approved manner.

REASON: To prevent the increased risk of flooding, to improve and protect water quality and to ensure that surface water is disposed of in the most sustainable way feasible, in accordance with policies 5.12, 5.13, 5.14 and 5.15 of the London Plan (2015) and Policy 5.12 of the Development Management DPD (Dec 2013), addressing Flood Risk Management. | 22. Prior to the construction of those elements of the development to be constructed with green roofs, full details of the proposed roofs, including method of construction and specifications of proposed planting, together with details of future maintenance programmes, shall be submitted to and approved, in writing, by the Local Planning Authority. Once approved, the development shall be carried out in the approved manner.

REASON: To ensure satisfactory development, in accordance with Policy 5.11 of the London Plan (2015) and Policy 5.11 of the Development Management DPD (Dec 2013). | 23. Prior to the first occupation of the development, a detailed Delivery and Servicing Plan shall be submitted and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. Once approved the use shall implemented and maintained in accordance with the approved details, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

REASON: To ensure the implementation of the development does not lead to disruption on the local highway network or to local residents and to safeguard the amenity of the Metropolitan Open Land, in accordance with policies 6.3, 6.11 and 7.17 of the London Plan (2015) and policies 1.1 (e), (f) & (j) and 5.2 of the Ealing Development (or Core) Strategy (2012). | 24. Prior to the development first being brought into use, a Parking Management Plan shall be submitted to and approved, in writing, by the Local Planning Authority, indicating how parking on the site would be controlled and monitored. The Parking Management Plan should also indicate how on site car parking provision would be reduced if the monitoring identifies that the level of provision initially provided is not required. Once approved the use shall be carried out fully in accordance with the approved details, unless any changes are agreed, in writing, by the Local Planning Authority.

REASON: To ensure the implementation of the development does not lead to disruption on the local highway network or to local residents and to safeguard the amenity of the Metropolitan Open Land, in accordance with policies 6.11 and 7.17 of the London Plan (2015) and Policy 5.2 of the Ealing Development (or Core) Strategy (2012). | 25. The premises shall be used as a sports facility for indoor and outdoor sporting activity and for ancillary activities and for no other purpose including any other uses falling within Class D2 of the Schedule to the Town and Country Planning (Use Classes) (Amendment) Order 2005, unless otherwise agreed with the Planning Authority.

REASON: In the interests of maintaining an appropriate use within Metropolitan Open Land, in accordance with policies 3.19 and 7.17 of the London Plan (2015) and policies 5.2 and 5.6 of the Ealing Development (or Core) Strategy (2012). | 26. The development hereby permitted shall be constructed in two phases and in accordance with drawing number 4558-POP-EW-00-MP-A-XX-1018 - Phasing Plan, illustrating the community element being constructed in the first phase.

REASON: In accordance with the details of the application and to secure the provision of appropriate community sporting facilities in this Metropolitan Open Land location, in accordance with policies 3.19 and 7.17 of the London Plan (2015) and policies 5.2 and 5.6 of the Ealing Development (or Core) Strategy (2012). | 27. The development hereby approved shall not be brought into use until a detailed Green Travel Plan has been adopted for the site, with appropriate mechanisms put in place to ensure the requirements of the plan are properly managed and enforced.

REASON: To accord with the terms of the application and to ensure appropriate measures are put in place to encourage users of the site to travel to the site by means other than the private car, in accordance with policies 6.9, 6.10 and 6.11 of the London Plan (2015), Policy 1.1 (e), (f), (g) of the (Core) Development Strategy DPD (2012) and the advice contained in the Council's adopted Supplementary Planning Document SPD (2013) Sustainable Transport for New Development. | 28. Notwithstanding the submitted information, full details of the location, scale and surface treatment of the proposed footway/cycleway shall be submitted and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority, prior to the first use of the development. The development shall be implemented in the approved manner and permanently maintained.

REASON: To accord with the terms of the application and to ensure accessibility by foot and cycle to the development, in accordance with policies 6.9 and 6.10 of the London Plan (2015). | 29. Prior to the first use of the development full design details of the proposed cycle parking facilities shall be submitted and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority and thereafter installed in the agreed locations and retained permanently.

REASON: To accord with the terms of the application and to ensure accessibility by cycle to the development, in accordance with Policy 6.9 of the London Plan (2015). | 30. Prior to first use of the development full details of coach parking, access and turning facilities shall be submitted to and approved, in writing, by the Local Planning Authority. Once approved, the facilities shall be provided before the development is brought into use and shall thereafter be permanently retained free of any impediment enabling its designated use.

REASON: To the interests of highway safety, in accordance with Policy 6.13 of the London Plan (2015). | 31. The development of each of the buildings hereby approved shall not commence until full details of the external finishing materials have been submitted to and approved, in writing, by the Local Planning Authority. The buildings shall thereafter be constructed in accordance with the approved details.

REASON: In the interests of visual amenity, in accordance with policies 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan (2015). | 32. Details of a shelter to be located within close proximity of and to serve the cricket wickets shall be submitted for the written approval of the Planning Authority, in consultation with Sport England, and thereafter implemented on site in the approved manner and maintained as appropriate for all time.

REASON: In order to comply with the functional requirements for the provision of outdoor recreation facilities, in accordance with Policy 5.6 of Ealing Core Development Strategy (2012). | 33. Prior to the development hereby approved being brought into use, full details of the number, design and location of Electric Vehicle Charging Points within the designated car parking areas shall be submitted to and approved, in writing, by the Local Planning Authority. The submitted information shall provide full details of both active and passive provision. The development shall be implemented on-site in the approved manner, made available prior to first use of the development, or in accordance with the agreed phasing programme and appropriately maintained thereafter.

REASON: To comply with Policy 6.13 of the London Plan (2015) and Policy 1.2 (k) of Ealing Core Development Strategy (April 2012). | 34. Prior to the commencement of the development (excluding demolition, site preparation works, site remediation works, or the formation of accesses), detailed plans and sections shall be submitted for the written approval of the Planning Authority, illustrating the amended fence line location and treatment of the embankment along the south-eastern perimeter of the site. The fence line shall be moved westwards by a sufficient distance, allowing the Council to improve the Right of Way to the east to accommodate pedestrians and cyclists. Thereafter, the works shall be implemented on-site in the approved manner.

REASON: In order to encourage sustainable modes of transport to the development from the residential areas at the north and to improve access and connectivity, in accordance with policies 6.9 and 6.10 of the London Plan (2015) and policies 1.1 (e) & (f) and 5.5 (d) of Ealing's Development (or Core) Strategy DPD (2012) and Policy 2.18 of Ealing's Development Management DPD (2013). | 35. Prior to the commencement of the development (excluding demolition, site preparation works, site remediation works, regrading or the formation of accesses), detailed plans and sections shall be submitted for the written approval of the Planning Authority, illustrating the amended details of the treatment of the western corner of the site adjoining Windmill Lane and showing the treatment of the cycle/pedestrian route as it adjoins the secondary, existing access to the site. Thereafter, the works shall be implemented on-site in the approved manner.

REASON: In order to encourage and facilitate sustainable modes of transport to the development and to improve access and connectivity, in accordance with policies 6.9 and 6.10 of the London Plan (2015) and policies 1.1 (e) & (f) and 5.5 (d) of Ealing's Development (or Core) Strategy DPD (2012) and Policy 2.18 of Ealing's Development Management DPD (2013).
